enWisdom: The cause of corruption of the mind is love of this world
The ornaments of this world corrupt weak minds

Wisdom: حُبُّ الدُّنْيَا يُفْسِدُ الْعَقْلَ وَيُهِمُّ [وَ يُصِمُ‏] الْقَلْبَ عَنْ سَمَاعِ الْحِكْمَةِ وَيُوجِبُ أَلِيمَ الْعِقَابِ
enWisdom: Love of this world corrupts the intellect, preoccupies the heart from listening to [words of] wisdom and leads to a painful chastisement [in the Hereafter]

Wisdom: لِحُبِّ الدُّنْيَا صَمَّتِ الْأَسْمَاعُ عَنْ سَمَاعِ الْحِكْمَةِ وَعَمِيَتِ الْقُلُوبُ عَنْ نُورِ الْبَصِيرَةِ
enWisdom: For love of this world, listeners turn a deaf ear to [words of] wisdom and hearts become blind to the light of insight
One who loves something speaks about it constantly
Aspirations blind the eyes of insight
Increased aspirations stem from corruption of the intellect

Wisdom: الْغَضَبُ يُفْسِدُ الْأَلْبَابَ وَيُبَعِّدُ مِنَ الصَّوَابِ
enWisdom: Anger corrupts intellects and distances one from the right (or from reward)

Wisdom: غَيْرُ مُنْتَفِعٍ بِالْحِكْمَةِ عَقْلٌ مَعْلُولٌ بِالْغَضَبِ وَالشَّهْوَةِ
enWisdom: The mind that is sick with anger and lust does not benefit from wisdom
The opinionated one falls into error and blunder

Wisdom: الِاسْتِبْدَادُ بِرَأْيِكَ يُزِلُّكَ وَيُهَوِّرُكَ فِي‏ الْمَهَاوِي
enWisdom: Being opinionated will make you slip and will cause you to fall into an abyss
Indeed the opinionated one has made an error [by not considering the other opinions]
Indeed one who thinks his opinion is sufficient [and does not seek advice] has taken a [huge] risk
Corruption of the intellect is [in] being deluded by deceptions
People are enemies of that which they are ignorant of
At times the intelligent person becomes blind to what is right
One who has lost his sight makes wrong judgments

Wisdom: لَقَدْ أَخْطَأَ الْعَاقِلُ اللَّاهِي الرُّشْدَ وَأَصَابَهُ ذُو الِاجْتِهَادِ وَالْجِدِّ
enWisdom: Indeed the intelligent one who is heedless strays from the path of right guidance and the one who strives with seriousness [to find it] gets it
One who is negligent becomes ignorant
One who thinks ill [of others], his innermost thoughts become evil

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي لِلْعَاقِلِ أَنْ يَحْتَرِسَ مِنْ سُكْرِ الْمَالِ وَسُكْرِ الْقُدْرَةِ وَسُكْرِ الْعِلْمِ وَسُكْرِ الْمَدْحِ وَسُكْرِ الشَّبَابِ فَإِنَّ لِكُلِّ ذَلِكَ رِيَاحاً خَبِيثَةً تَسْلُبُ الْعَقْلَ وَتَسْتَخِفُّ الْوَقَارَ
enWisdom: It behoves the intelligent one to protect himself from the intoxication of wealth, the intoxication of power, the intoxication of knowledge, the intoxication of praise and the intoxication of youth, for each of these have foul odours that take away intelligence and reduces dignity
